column4: what is the name of the package that contains the manpages on ubuntu?
you probably want the development ones? manpages-dev
Hmm that didn't seem to work, I installed both manpages and manpages-dev
yep. i just installed it and got fopen
hmm I did too but it still says "-bash: man command not found"
that's... strange you shouldn't be missing man
this is a fresh install from a linode vps
Still no manpages, I used apt-get purge manpages to remove it... I also did a apt-get update and apt-get upgrade to see if that would help and still nothing
er... why'd you remove the manpages?
Got it working by installing man-db
